content.user_title: Add rich text editors with Plate.js
content.value_statement: Building rich text editors from scratch is complex and time-consuming. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for implementing Plate.js editors, from simple comment inputs to full-featured document editors with headings, lists, and media support.
actual_capabilities: Install Plate.js components via shadcn CLI commands
Create simple editors for comments, chat, and short text
Build detailed editors with headings, quotes, and lists
Implement state management for editor content
Follow best practices for component registration
limitations: Does not provide pre-built components, only implementation guidance
Requires existing shadcn/ui setup in the project
Does not cover server-side rendering or backend storage
Assumes basic familiarity with React and TypeScript

best_practices: Use .withComponent() when registering plugins that render custom elements like headings and blockquotes
Store editor content as JSON using onChange callback rather than HTML for better security
Install base UI components via shadcn CLI to ensure consistency with your design system
anti_patterns: Avoid dangerouslySetInnerHTML for editable content; use Plate's value prop instead
Do not skip component registration for plugins that render custom elements
Avoid hardcoding toolbar layouts; use the FixedToolbar and FloatingToolbar components properly

faq.question: Does Plate.js work with Next.js?
faq.answer: Yes, use 'use client' directive since Plate.js requires client-side rendering. All editor components must be client components.

faq.question: What is the difference between simple and detailed editors?
faq.answer: Simple editors have basic marks only. Detailed editors include elements like headings, lists, quotes, tables, and media support.

faq.question: How do I save editor content to a database?
faq.answer: Use the onChange prop to capture the value as JSON. Serialize to your preferred format (JSON, HTML, or markdown) before storing.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides guidance. It does not access your files, network, or execute any code on your system.

faq.question: Why is my toolbar not appearing?
faq.answer: Ensure FixedToolbar is placed inside the Plate provider component and that toolbar button components are properly imported from shadcn/ui.

faq.question: How does Plate.js compare to other editors like Slate or TipTap?
faq.answer: Plate.js is built on Slate architecture, offering a plugin-based approach. It integrates well with shadcn/ui and provides excellent TypeScript support.
